required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of a Fish Oil Containing Lipid Emulsion
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double Blind, Controlled, Parallel Group, Multicenter Study on the Efficacy and Safety of a Fish Oil Containing Lipid Emulsion vs. a Medium and Long Chain Lipid Emulsion in Patients Undergoing Elective Abdominal Surgery of Moderate Severity

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare a fish oil containing lipid emulsion against a medium-chain/long-chain triglyceride (MCT/LCT) lipid emulsion in terms of their efficacy and safety during postoperative parenteral nutrition.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: To investigate on the efficacy of fish oil on the nutrition status
primary_outcome.description: Prealbumin as the primary endpoint variable

primary_outcome.measure: To investigate on the efficacy of fish oil on an inflammatory parameter
primary_outcome.description: LTB5/LTB4 as a second primary endpoint

intervention.description: medium chain triglycerides, long chain triglycerides, omega-3 fatty acid containing triglycerides
medium chain triglycerides, long chain triglycerides

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients considered for open abdominal surgery of moderate severity, e.g.. radical operation for stomach cancer or pancreaticoduodenal surgery
- Male and female patients â‰¥18 and <85 years of age
- Indication for total parenteral nutrition therapy: for at least 5 consecutive days after operation
- Ability and willingness to give voluntary consent to participate in the study, following a full explanation of the nature and purpose of the study, by signing the informed consent form approved by the Institutional Review Board (IRB) prior to all evaluations, and to comply with the requirements of the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- General contraindications for parenteral nutrition (acidosis of various geneses, untreated disorders of electrolyte and fluid intake and output, inadequate cellular oxygen supply)
- General contraindications for infusion therapy such as acute pulmonary oedema, hyperhydration and decompensated cardiac insufficiency
- Known hypersensitivity to egg-, soy-, and fish proteins or any of the ingredients
- Other
